intro: Sigmatostalix auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate sigmatostalix, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in secondary forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
